conclusion: Consider conditions for total internal reflection.
Total internal reflection occurs when angle of incidence is greater than critical angle.
Medium is air with refractive index n = 1.
If incident angle I is large enough, it will be greater than 90 degrees.
Law of reflection states angle of incidence equals angle of reflection.
Light incident on sphere from air will be reflected back into air at same angle.
Light will be totally reflected when emitted from inside of sphere.
